TopicTitle: Does anything in a cargobay lose all of its drag?

Articles.Content: So I heard something about cargo bays working so that anything inside of them has no drag. Is this true?
I think it does still drag. I believe Maxmaps said that it got pushed back to 0.26. So as far as i know in 0.25 parts still have drag inside the cargo bays.

So I heard something about cargo bays working so that anything inside of them has no drag. Is this true?

It might depend on the specific cargo bay part (mod).

Generally speaking, the answer is "no" in the current stock game version, as drag is calculated by a very simplistic model.

The anser is generally "yes" if you have the Ferram Aerospace mod installed.
Yep, cargo bays and fairings are essential if you're playing with FAR.

Drag is currently calculated based on mass (in stock). So no, it would not remove drag.

In FAR I'm pritty sure cargo bay will effect drag though

So I heard something about cargo bays working so that anything inside of them has no drag. Is this true?

I'm certain what you are referring to is a result of Maxmaps posting a tweet that the new cargo bay would be able to house parts inside and would shield the drag (stock parts with stock aerodynamics). As worir4 said, Max later followed it up with another tweet saying that it's not going to be in 0.25. So we have to wait until at least 0.26 (or maybe later) before we see this.

Cheers,

~Claw
